message.content:
cs.CV, cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.CL, cs.LG 

The paper deals with the problem of organizing large collections of unstructured smartphone photos into topics and categories. This involves image analysis, natural language processing, and machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), which deals with image and video analysis. The paper also uses probabilistic Latent Semantic Analysis and a lexical database, which are techniques commonly used in information retrieval (cs.IR). In addition, the paper uses Convolutional Neural Networks (cs.MM) to estimate topic-related categories. The paper also mentions the use of natural language processing techniques to assign names to topics, which falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). Finally, the paper uses machine learning techniques to validate the proposed approach, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG).
